III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility does not serve clients from the plaintiff class that fall under the
Modified Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP).
3.) The facility does not have a contract with the department.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Ensure the 3 required references are not from family members.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or corporal punishment
during this licensing period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing
period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator did not have much to report in her assessment as the facility
did not have any violations last year, so they did not have any corrective actions. She
also did not note anything they needed to improve on which is reflected in the lack of
violations this year. They had one unanticipated discharge when a youth ran away
from the facility.
Interviews
Three staff and three youth were interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/9/22. The
biggest concern expressed by staff is the same concern expressed by all CCI’s
currently and that is finding staff. They did not have any other concerns. The youth
also did not have any concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
